stories.text:
I saw a job posting for Compound and browsed their site. But I still have questions. Maybe someone here knows.

They say they're targeting employees of startups. Is this really a big enough market to support the company? Is there really no other company that can handle financial advice for startup employees? I don't think it would be that difficult for someone with a CFA to handle, and should be 90% the same as a "normal" employee. What am I missing?

They mention they're different than traditional advisors or robo advisors. I didn't see mention of what they actually are though. Also, I think I saw an article that Vanguard has started low cost personalized advice. How does this compare to that?
stories.title: Ask HN: How is Compound (YC startup) different?
